The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Trevoria ecuadoriensis has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
